description.p: You gain the following Oath Spells at the paladin levels listed.
You gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

sheet.description: As an action, you present your holy symbol and call upon the Raven Queen, allowing Death’s Hardening to settle upon those who resist their appointed end. The cold of death seeps into your enemies. All enemy creatures you can see within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your paladin spell save DC or be affected by Death’s Hardening for a number of rounds equal to your proficiency bonus. While affected in this way, a creature’s speed becomes 0, and it can’t take the Dash action. Undead and fiends affected by Death’s Hardening also have disadvantage on attack rolls. On a successful saving throw, a creature’s speed is halved until the end of your next turn. The effect ends early if an affected creature is more than 30 feet away from you at the end of its turn.

element.name: Channel Divinity: The Hold of Death

sheet.description: As a reaction when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you would be reduced to 0 hit points, you present your holy symbol and invoke the Raven Queen’s judgment upon the creature. The creature is instead reduced to 1 hit point. Until the end of its next turn, it can’t regain hit points. This ability has no effect on constructs, undead, or fiends.

description.p: While you are conscious, you emanate an aura that carries the silent presence of death, veiled in shadow, making its nearness unmistakably felt.

When an enemy creature within the aura hits you or a friendly creature with an attack, the enemy falters as it realizes its own mortality. Until the end of its next turn, the first attack roll that creature makes is made with disadvantage.
A creature can be affected by this aura only once per round, regardless of how many attacks it makes.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

sheet.description: While you are conscious, you emanate an aura ({{aura:radius}} ft). When an enemy in the aura hits you or a friendly creature with an attack, until the end of its next turn the first attack roll it makes is with disadvantage. A creature can be affected only once per round.
Same effect; radius increases to 30 feet.

description.p: When a creature within The Queen’s Veil hits you or a friendly creature with an attack, you can use your reaction to mark that creature, as the veil between life and death grows thin.
The marked creature can’t become invisible to you while it remains within your aura, and you have advantage on the first attack roll you make against it.
The mark ends when you hit the creature with an attack or when it leaves your aura. If you are incapacitated, this mark immediately ends.
If the marked creature is an undead or a fiend, you instead have advantage on the first two attack rolls you make against it.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When a creature within your aura hits you or a friendly creature with an attack, you can mark it (if you aren’t incapacitated). While it remains within your aura, it can’t become invisible to you. You have advantage on the first attack roll you make against it (or the first two if it is an undead or fiend). The mark ends when you hit it or when it leaves your aura (and ends immediately if you become incapacitated).

description.p: As an action, you fully surrender yourself to the Queen’s presence for 1 minute. Shadows gather tightly around your body, turning into raven-like wings of living shadows. While in this state, you gain a flying speed of 60 feet, can hover, move without sound, and your movement does not provoke opportunity attacks. The Raven Queen’s stillness settles within you, rendering you immune to the frightened and charmed conditions for the duration.

The shadows bound to your presence spread outward, forming a 30-foot veil in all directions. Within this veil, bright light becomes dim light, and dim light becomes darkness. When darkness is created in this way, nonmagical light cannot fully pierce it, illuminating at most a 5-foot radius of dim light, while magical light can illuminate only a 10-foot radius. Light is not extinguished by this effect; instead, it is consumed and drawn into the silence of death.

While this feature remains active, the presence of death settles deeply into those who remain within the veil. At the end of each enemy creature’s turn within this area, if that creature did not hit a target with an attack during its turn, death seeps into its body and spirit, dealing cold or necrotic damage (your choice) equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).
Once you become the Avatar of the Queen, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: For 1 minute, gain raven-like wings of living shadows (fly 60 ft., hover), move without sound, and your movement does not provoke opportunity attacks. You are immune to the frightened and charmed conditions. Shadows form a 30-foot veil: bright light becomes dim light; dim light becomes darkness. In this darkness, nonmagical light illuminates at most 5 feet of dim light; magical light illuminates at most 10 feet. At the end of each enemy’s turn within the veil, if it did not hit a target with an attack that turn, it takes cold or necrotic damage (your choice) equal to your CHA modifier (minimum 1).

description.p: Paladins of the Oath of the Raven swear themselves to the Raven Queen, keeper of the boundary that all lives must one day cross. They revere life as a fleeting passage and uphold death as a rightful end, neither to be feared nor denied. They stand as guardians of the threshold, intervening only when the natural order is denied or defied.
